<i>noun</i><br><ol><li>the Apocalypse</l:
verb
  1. to butcher; to slaughter for meat
  2. to shoot dead
  3. to cut down (a tree)
  4. to destroy or demolish (a wall)
  5. (reflexive) to fall down, especially of tall things, such as trees
  6. (takes a reflexive pronoun) to descend upon with violence or furor
  7. (takes a reflexive pronoun, of lightning) to strike

noun
  1. a piece of food to taste before eating it

noun
  1. waste wine
  2. the last vintage of a wine barrel

verb
  1. to go to hell (literal or insult)
  2. to ingest some medicine for any winter disease

verb
  1. (transitive) to join or mix together
  2. (transitive) to mate animals for breeding
  3. (transitive) to prepare
  4. (transitive) to fit with a prosthesis
  5. (intransitive, nautical) to cast off

verb
  1. (transitive) to call (out)
  2. (transitive) to call, phone, ring
  3. (transitive) to call for, summon
  4. (intransitive) to call (out)
  5. (reflexive) to be called

<i>noun</i><br><ol><li>the Apocalypse</l:
verb
  1. (intransitive) To stay up, sit up.
  2. (intransitive) To keep guard, keep watch.
  3. (intransitive) To look after, see to ( + ài); see to it that ( + ài çacque)
  4. (intransitive) To watch over (someone) ( + sur).
  5. (transitive) To keep watch over a sick person at night; to do a death wake for.

verb
  1. to turn off (a switch)
  2. to put out (a fire)
  3. (reflexive) to die out, fade
